ORAL ANSWERS TO QUESTIONS : , : DEPARTMENT OF IMMIGRATION AND EMIGRATION : AIRPORT EMPLOYEES
asked the Prime Minister and Minister of Buddha Sasana and Religious Affairs:
(i) the number of employees of the Department of Immigration and Emigration detailed for duties at the Katunayake airport ;and
(ii) the qualifications to be fulfilled by the aforesaid employees engaged in duties at the airport?
(i) whether outsiders who do not belong to the Department of Immigration and Emigration have been detailed for duties of that Department at the Katunayake airport ;
(ii) if so, the number of such persons ;
(iii) of the qualifications of such persons ; and
(iv) of the reasons for the deployment of such a group?
: : WHOLESALE FERTILIZER DISTRIBUTOR OF ANURADHAPURA DISTRICT: DISTRIBUTION
asked the Minister of Agrarian Services and Wildlife:

(i) whether an organization named Krushikarmika Govijana Vagakaruwange Sanvidanaya functions as the wholesale fertilizer distributor of the Anuradhapura District under the fertilizer subsidy programme of the government ;and
(ii) the year in which the above organization started distributing fertilizer?
(b) Will he inform this House separately-
(i) on per year basis, the stocks of each type of fertilizer issued by Colombo Commercial Fertilizer Company Limited to the above wholesale distributor from 2006 to 2010 ; and
(ii) of the amounts of each types of fertilizer distributed to Agrarian Services Centres by the aforesaid wholesale distributor by 2009?
(i) if a deficiency exists according to the comparison of the stocks of fertilizer received by the aforesaid distributor and the stocks distributed by it, the amount of it ; and
(ii) the value of the deficient stocks in terms of the market value of a metric tonne of fertilizer?
(i) the government and farmers have had to incur a loss owing to the above situation ; and
(ii) a fraud has been committed by the relevant distributor?

: BANK OF CEYLON BUILDING AT YORK STREET: LEASE-OUT
() , ? asked the Minister of Finance and Planning:
(i) whether a decision has been taken to rent out the Bank of Ceylon building at York Street, which has been declared as a national heritage, to a hotel management company ;
(ii) whether the metropolitan branch and the other sections of the bank housed in the aforesaid building will be removed from it ;
(iii) whether the G.O.H. hotel that belongs to the Bank of Ceylon and housed in the Bank of Ceylon building at York Street is running at a loss ; and
(iv) the courses of action that will be taken with regard to that situation?

: : AGREEMENT WITH BOARD OF INVESTMEN: STATE ENTERPRISES AND COMPANIES
asked the Minister of Economic Development:

(a) Will he state- (i) the number of state enterprises requested and the number of companies entered into agreement with the Board of Investment under Section 16 and Section 17 of BOI Act from 01/01/2009 to date per year and per section basis; (ii) the number of enterprises in (a) (i) above that have started commercial operations to date; and (iii) the value of the investment that has been done as per (a) (i) above?

(b) Will he inform this House- (i) the tax holidays enjoyed by aforesaid companies; and (ii) the number of companies registered and commenced operations during the period from 01/01/2006 to 31/12/2008 on the basis of per year and per section of Board of Investment?

: PROJECTS OF RUBBER RESEARCH INSTITUTE : COST 0721/10
asked the Minister of Plantation Industries:
(i) the locations where the projects of the Rubber Research Institute are situated;
(ii) whether one such unit is situated in Kalutara district; and
(iii) if so, the name of that location?
(i) whether the cost for research projects of the Rubber Research Institute in year 2000 of which the Auditor General had queried was about Rs 700-800 million, where there was no collateral assets;
(ii) if not so, the correct figure of cost incurred for research in aforesaid year;
(iii) whether the matter was referred to the Commission to investigate bribery or corruption; and
(iv) if so, the outcome of the investigation ?
(c) Will he inform this House the sources from which the money was allocated to this entity, which did not have such money to spend at the time, they entered into an agreement ?
( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe - Minister of Plantation Industries) , .
( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) , . ? ( ) (The Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe) Sri Lanka Rubber Manufacturing and Export Corporation ? That does not come under us.
( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Then, under which Ministry does it come?
( ) (The Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe) It comes under the Ministry of State Resources and Enterprise Development.
( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Oh! That is the Ministry which has been given to the Hon. P. Dayaratna. Is it?
( ) (The Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe) I was replying to you in relation to the Rubber Research Institute.

(ii) of the functions performed by those departments and institutions ; and
(iii) the amount of money spent for each such function?
(c) Will he state the Ministerial Expenditure Head under which allocations were made by the last Budget for above mentioned expenses?

. Laws and Regulations Obstructing Investment" library . . . , , . . . , . Strategic Investment Law . . . . . . . :

2. If the Governments targeted 8 per cent growth is to be achieved, the total investment of the country should be around 35-40 per cent of GDP. Further, public investment needs to be maintained at around 6-7 per cent of GDP in the medium term and private investment needs to be increased from the current level of 19-20 per cent to beyond 30 per cent. Such a rapid increase in investment cannot be attracted through our domestic resources alone, since domestic savings are inadequate. Under such circumstances, while expediting a national development drive, the country must attract foreign investment.

3. If we are to achieve the growth target of 8 per cent, we must create an investor friendly, political, social and economic environment in the country. There are over 150 other developing countries in the world competing to attract
foreign investment. As the saying goes, we are not the 'only girl on the beach'. Hence hindrances to investment need to be identified and overcome and eliminated.
, , . Strategic Investment Law . Strategic Development Project . :

A Strategic Development Project is a project which is in the national interest/which is likely to bring economic and social benefit to the county/which is also likely to change the landscape of the country, primarily through,
(i) the strategic importance attached to the proposed provision of goods and services, which will be of benefit to the public
(ii) the substantial flow of foreign exchange to the country
(iii) the substantial employment which will be generated and the enhancement of the income earning opportunities
(iv) the envisaged transformation in terms of technology.

strategic investment . . Inland Revenue Act, Value Added Tax Act, Finance Act, Excise (Special Provisions) Act, Economic Service Charge Act, Debits Tax Act and Customs Ordinance . " , " . , Strategic Investment Law . ; . . .

. ! . , . . , . ; . , . You have to write off the loans which they have taken from the bank for cultivation. That is why I request you, Hon. Basil Rajapaksa, to please give them compensation for the jewelleries that were robbed.

WRITTEN ANSWERS TO QUESTIONS : : LAND BELONGING TO LAND REFORMS COMMISSION: TANGALLE DIVISIONAL SECRETARY'S DIVISION
? () , ? asked the Prime Minister and Minister of Buddha Sasana and Religious Affairs:
(a) Will he submit to this House -
(i) whether there are lands belonging to Land Reforms Commission within the Tangalle Divisional Secretariat Division;
(ii) the name, extent, relevant Grama Niladhari division, nature of land and annual income of each land;
(iii) whether the ownership of the aforesaid lands has been legally transferred to individuals/institutions;
(iv) the purpose for which the ownership was transferred and the basis on which it was done; and
(v) the name of the individual or institution, address, date of transfer, extent of land, relevant period and the annual income received by the Commission ?
(i) whether lands of the Commission are occupied by individuals or institutions in an illegal manner;
(ii) if so, their names, extent of land and date of occupation;
(iii) the measures taken in that respect and the current situation;
(iv) the extent of land in possession of the Commission at its inception and as at 01.08.2009;
(v) the extent of land alienated out of the extent in possession at the inception; and
(vi) the names of the persons to whom land was alienated, their addresses and the extent of land ?
( .. - , ) (The Hon. D.M. Jayaratne - Prime Minister, Minister of Buddha Sasana and Religious Affairs)
(iv) For housing and development requirements on sale basis
(iii) Action is underway to regularize encroachment
: : LAND BELONGING TO LAND REFORMS COMMISSION: BELIATTA DIVISIONAL SECRETARY'S DIVISION
asked the Prime Minister and Minister of Buddha Sasana and Religious Affairs:
(a) Will he submit to this House -
(i) iwhether there are lands belonging to Land Reforms Commission within the Beliatta Divisional Secretaris Division;
(ii) the name, extent, relevant Grama Niladhari division, nature of land and annual income of each land;
(iii) whether the ownership of the aforesaid lands has been legally transferred to individuals/institutions;
(iv) the purpose for which the ownership was transferred and the basis on which it was done; and
(v) the name of the individual or institution, address, date of transfer, extent of land, relevant period and the annual income received by the Commission ?
(i) whether lands of the Commission are occupied by individuals or institutions in an illegal manner;

(ii) if so, their names, extent of land and date of occupation; (iii) the measures taken in that respect and the current situation; (iv) the extent of land in possession of the Commission at its inception and as at 01.08.2009; (v) the extent of land alienated out of the extent in possession at the inception; and (vi) the names of the persons to whom land was alienated, their addresses and the extent of land ?
(c) If not, why ? .. ( .. ) (The Hon. D.M. Jayaratne)
(iv) On sale basis and lease basis.
(ii) 18 Acres 2 Roods 31 Perches have been encroached.
(iii) Action is underway to regularize encroachment.
SRI LANKANS EMPLOYED IN FOREIGN COUNTRIES : REVENUE
asked the Minister of Foreign Employment Promotion and Welfare:
(a) Will he state the number of Sri Lankans employed in foreign countries during the period from 2005 to 2010, separately for each year, in terms of each country and the field of employment ?
(b) Will he inform this House separately with respect to each year-
(i) the income Sri Lanka earned through foreign employees during the period from 2005 to 2010;
(ii) that income as a percentage of the total government revenue ?
(c) If not, why ? ( ) ( - , ) (The Hon. Dilan Perera - Minister of Foreign Employment Promotion and Welfare)
(a) Accurate date is available only in respect of the number of Sri Lankans going abroad annually for employment. This data is given in Attachment 1. (placed in the library)
(ii) Year Remittance Total Remittance as (Rs. Million) Government a % of total Revenue revenue (Rs. Million)
() , ? asked the Minister of Foreign Employment Promotion and Welfare,- (2)
(i) of the government institution where a foreign employment agency operative in Sri Lanka should be registered;
(ii) of the conditions to be met for such registration;
(iii) of the number of foreign employment agencies that have been registered by now, their names and addresses ?
(i) the number, names and addresses of unregistered foreign employment agencies, if such agencies have been identified;
(ii) the measures that have been taken by now and will be taken in future regarding such agencies;

(iii) the number of foreign employment agencies whose registrations have been cancelled or that have been subjected to legal action as a result of breaching the basic conditions later, eventhough they had been registered during the period from 2005 to 2010?
(i) whether there are sub-agencies for foreign employment operative in this country ;
(ii) whether such agencies should be registered with the Bureau of Foreign Employment or any other government institution;
(iii) if so, of the conditions relevant to that ;
(iv) of the number of sub-agencies that have been registered in that manner, their names and addresses?
(d) If not, why ? ( ) (The Hon. Dilan Perera)
(a) (i) Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment
(i) if an individual, is a citizen of Sri Lanka;
(ii) if a firm, is a firm all the partners of which are citizens of Sri Lanka; or
(iii) if a company, is a company the majority of the shares of which is held by citizens of Sri Lanka, and
(b) the applicant, if an individual, or in the case of a firm or company, the person to be in charge of the business, is a person of good repute

(c) the premises in which the business is to be carried on are suitable, having regard to the locality in which the premises are situated, the size[ of the premises and the facilities in those premises;
(d) the applicant has paid the prescribed fee for the issue of the license; (Rs. 10,000/-+Tax) and,
(e) the applicant has complied with the requirements of section 28
(i) Before the issue of a a license under this Act the Bureau shall direct the applicant-
(a) to enter into an agreement with the Bureau-
(i) to carry on the business in a morally irreproachable manner, and

(ii) to take all steps as are reasonably possible to ensure that the terms and conditions of any contract of employment between a foreign employment and a person recruited for employment under such employer by the applicant, are observed by that employment;

(b) to enter into a bond with the bureau with two sureties in such sum not less than Seven Hundred & Fifty Thousand Rupees, as may be determined by the bureau for the satisfaction of claims which might arise in connection with the business or any contract of employment referred to in paragraph (a);

(c) to furnish a Bank Guarantee to the satisfaction of the bureau in such sum not less than Seven Hundred & Fifty Thousand Rupees, as may be determined by the bureau, to be in force for a period of twenty-four consecutive months from the date of issue of a license for the connection with the business or any contract of employment referred to in paragraph (a); and
(b) (i) At present 84 unregistered Foreign Employment Agencies have been identified.

(ii) If a person or an institute has not taken a licence from under Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment, Bureau has to produce them to the magistrate under Section 62(2) of Act No.21 of 1985 amended by 04 of 1994 and 56 of 2009.
(d) Unlawful according to the provisions of the Act. No. 21 of 1985 amended by Act No. 4 of 1994 and No.56 of 2009 section 62(i)
